author: Ambitocom
title: Turismo: Victoria Villarruel se reuniÃ³ con referentes del sector en Bariloche
text:
La vicepresidenta Victoria Villarruel se reuniÃ³ esta tarde con empresarios del sector turÃ­stico en Bariloche para discutir sobre el nivel de ocupaciÃ³n de la temporada , la proyecciÃ³n de la ciudad como destino, la polÃ­tica de cielos abiertos y otros puntos claves que afectan a la actividad.
El contenido al que quiere acceder es exclusivo para suscriptores.
suscribirse ya estoy suscripto La presidenta del Senado fue recibida por el ministro de Gobierno de RÃ­o Negro, Federico Lutz y por el nuevo secretario de Turismo provincial, Marcos Barberis. Del encuentro tambiÃ©n participaron empresarios de la CÃ¡mara de Comercio, de la FederaciÃ³n de Empresas y Entidades de Bariloche, de la CÃ¡mara de Turismo, de la AsociaciÃ³n Empresaria Hotelera y GastronÃ³mica, y de la AsociaciÃ³n de Agencias de Viajes y del Bureau Bariloche.
Informate mÃ¡s Senado: se desplazÃ³ a UniÃ³n por la Patria de la conformaciÃ³n de comisiones Javier Milei insistiÃ³ con las SAD para el fÃºtbol argentino: "Son un negocio fÃ¡cil" SegÃºn trascendiÃ³, los referentes del sector turÃ­stico le pidieron a Villarruel la designaciÃ³n de un funcionario en la cartera de Turismo para tener un interlocutor en el Gobierno con el que poder dialogar sobre las preocupaciones principales de la actividad.
Desde La Libertad Avanza desminitieron los rumores de reuniÃ³n entre Villarruel y Macri en el Sur A pesar de los rumores de que la Vicepresidenta tambiÃ©n se habÃ­a reunido con Mauricio Macri en su country CumelÃ©n de Villa La Angostura, desde La Libertad Avanza rÃ¡pidamente desmintieron esa informaciÃ³n.
Horas antes, el dirigente social y lÃ­der del Frente Patria Grande, Juan Grabois , denunciÃ³ una "conspiraciÃ³n" entre Macri y Villarruel para "voltear" a Milei y quedarse con el Gobierno.
Agencias de viajes y turismo pidieron la inconstitucionalidad del DNU de Javier Milei Uno de los sectores mÃ¡s preocupados por las primeras medidas del oficialismo es el turÃ­stico. En las Ãºltimas horas, la FederaciÃ³n Argentina de Asociaciones de Empresas de Viajes y Turismo (Faevyt) , que representa a todas las agencias de viajes argentinas, presentÃ³ un amparo mediante el cual solicitÃ³ que la Justicia declare la inconstitucionalidad del DNU 70/2023 en el punto en el cual pretende derogar el rÃ©gimen general de los agentes de viajes (Ley 18.829).
â€œEs fundamental resaltar que la derogaciÃ³n del rÃ©gimen de agentes de viajes impacta directamente sobre los derechos adquiridos por las empresas de viajes y turismo que, cumpliendo con esta ley, brindan seguridad a los pasajeros y estabilidad al sector ", dijo el presidente de esa entidad, AndrÃ©s DeyÃ¡ , a travÃ©s de un comunicado.
En ese sentido agregÃ³ que "la desapariciÃ³n de esta norma promoverÃ­a una competencia absolutamente desleal con personas que no son profesionales de la actividad turÃ­stica y que no tendrÃ¡n ningÃºn control para cumplir correctamente con su labor ni brindar ningÃºn tipo de garantÃ­a a los pasajeros â€.

author: Rebecca Downs
title: House Democrats Are Still Going After the Trump Family With Baseless Attacks
text: Even though Donald Trump left the White House years ago, Democrats still relentlessly go after him and his family for what they perceive to be some sort of influence in a desperate attempt to distract from the influence of [the Biden crime family](https://townhall.com/tags/biden-crime-family), especially when it comes to First Son Hunter Biden's shady business dealings. During Wednesday's House Oversight Committee on "Defending America from the Chinese Communist Partyâ€™s Political Warfare," Rep. Robert Garcia (D-CA), a particularly relentless member when it comes to attacking Trump and his family, brought up Ivanka Trump and her supposed involvement in China. "The Trump Crime family took foreign bribes and illegal gifts while in the White House â€“ and now post-presidency," Garcia claimed in an X post, where he also included a clip of his use of time during the hearing. He even used harsh language, asking, "Where's that damn investigation?" "In April of 2017, with Trump's White House in chaos, many people, including the Chinese government, were all trying to gain influence," Garcia claimed. "During this time, Ivanka Trump was working in the White House, got preliminary approval for three Chinese trademarks on the same day that Donald Trump had dinner with XI Jinping at Mar-A-Lago. And remember, Ivanka never divested her company while she was working in the White House," he continued, specifically targeting the former president's oldest daughter." The Trump Crime family took foreign bribes and illegal gifts while in the White House - and now post presidency.â€” Congressman Robert Garcia (@RepRobertGarcia) Whereâ€™s that damn investigation? [https://t.co/coJl0VSjY3] [June 26, 2024] The moment was enough to earn a headline from Mediaite declaring, " [Democrat Nukes Trump And His Daughter Ivanka For Profiting Off 'Favors' From China While In White House](https://www.mediaite.com/politics/democrat-nukes-trump-and-his-daughter-ivanka-for-profiting-off-favors-from-china-while-in-white-house/)." Recommended A spokesperson for Ivanka Trump said in a statement to Townhall, "These claims are demonstrably false." Some key context for Ivanka Trump's trademarks came from a 2017 article from the Washington Post, " [From diet pills to underwear: Chinese firms scramble to grab Ivanka Trump trademark](https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/asia_pacific/from-diet-pills-to-underwear-chinese-firms-scramble-to-grab-ivanka-trump-trademark/2017/02/24/9a6ecea4-fa96-11e6-9b3e-ed886f4f4825_story.html)." She was looking to prevent the Chinese from profiting off of her. It was a move that many were jumping at the chance for, with hundreds of applications. As the piece mentions: Chinese companies have been scrambling to add [Ivanka's] name to their products since her father won the U.S. presidential election in November. Thereâ€™s even a new Chinese cosmetic-surgery firm offering the chance to look a little more like her. An astounding 258 trademark applications were lodged under variations of Ivanka, Ivanka Trump and similar-sounding Chinese characters between Nov. 10 and the end of last year, records at the China Trademark Office show. None appear to have a direct business link with the U.S. presidentâ€™s daughter. ... Other applications have been lodged for â€œIvanka,â€ â€œIvanka Trump,â€ and a few for the characters ä¾ä¸‡å¡, which also spell yiwanka. ... Taking advantage of â€” or faking â€” foreign brands is common in China, as is the practice of â€œtrademark squatting,â€ whereby someone preemptively registers a spurious trademark claim in the hope of later being paid to relinquish it. Regarding Garcia's claim that "Ivanka never divested her company while she was working in the White House," a CNN article from January 2017, right before Trump took office, tells a different story. " [Ivanka Trump goes further than her father in divestment](https://www.cnn.com/2017/01/11/politics/ivanka-trump-divestment-donald-trump/index.html)," the headline reads, with the piece specifically mentioning her company: â€œShe wants to go beyond what her father did, because she doesnâ€™t believe he has to deal with conflicts, she wants to. The reason she wants to? She plans to be a â€˜modern-day first daughter,â€™â€ said Monica Langley, a CNN political analyst and senior special writer at the Wall Street Journal. â€œSheâ€™s going to be in the West Wing and be one of his top advisers.â€ Ivanka Trump is taking a formal leave of absence from the Trump Organization and her apparel and accessories brand when her father assumes office, she wrote in a Facebook post Wednesday. â€œI will no longer be involved with the management or operations of either company,â€ she wrote. There was also backlash against Garcia's claims from Alex Bruesewitz as well as Rep. Lance Gooden (R-TX). Bruesewitz held nothing back as he claimed Garcia "is rivaling Eric Swalwell for the dumbest member of Congress award now that Adam Kinzinger is gone," and that Garcia "blatantly LIED" with such claims. "She simply registered trademarks in China to prevent the Chinese from profiting off of her name. She makes NO money in China," Bruesewitz offered about Ivanka. He also brought the conversation back to the Biden family, adding, "Crackhead Hunter Biden took in millions from the CCP and 10% (probably more) went to the 'Big Guy,'" a title [used to refer to](https://townhall.com/tipsheet/guybenson/2024/02/23/bobulinski-n2635593) then Vice President Joe Biden, as former Hunter Biden associate Tony Bobulinski [has made clear](https://townhall.com/tipsheet/guybenson/2024/02/23/bobulinski-n2635593). Robert Garcia, who is rivaling Eric Swalwell for the dumbest member of Congress award now that Adam Kinzinger is gone, blatantly LIED aboutâ€” Alex Bruesewitz ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@alexbruesewitz) [@IvankaTrump]yesterday by claiming she was doing business in China. She simply registered trademarks in China to prevent the Chinese fromâ€¦ [June 27, 2024] Gooden similarly stressed the false nature of Garcia's claims, explaining Ivanka "applied for trademark rights for her own name." "She never used those trademarks and only applied for them to prevent the Chinese from profiting off of her," Gooden continued, emphasizing Garcia's claims are "Just another Democrat HOAX!" Yesterday a Democrat LIED aboutâ€” Lance Gooden (@Lancegooden) [@IvankaTrump]during a congressional hearing. He falsely claimed that Ivanka was doing business in China because she applied for trademark rights for her own name. She never used those trademarks and only applied for them to prevent the Chineseâ€¦ [June 27, 2024]

author: Shawn Johnson
title: Tories are 'dismissing' young people by labeling rising numbers as 'economically inactive'
text:
Labor has said the Tories are â€œwriting offâ€ young people, with the number of young people out of work due to â€œlong-term illnessâ€ doubling since 2010.
Sir Keir Starmer's party said that in 2010/11, 116,000 young people aged 16 to 24 were out of work or were not looking for employment due to long-term illness.
The party said the number of people unemployed now stands at 235,000, according to the latest figures from the Office for National Statistics (ONS) for the whole of Britain.
Shadow Work and Pensions Secretary Liz Kendall said: â€œBy ignoring the essential foundations for a healthy economy, the Tories are writing off hundreds of thousands of young people.â€
The Labor MP said his party would ensure young people do not fall through the cracks between services and government departments.
She hopes that improving mental health services, as well as reducing NHS waiting lists and strengthening workers' rights, will help tackle the â€œroot causesâ€ of economic inactivity.
Ms Kendall said: â€œLabour will tackle the root causes of economic inactivity, including the mental health crisis faced by many of our young people.
â€œWe will transform mental health services, reduce NHS waiting lists, boost skills, strengthen employment rights and provide tailored job support.â€
Chancellor Jeremy Hunt and Work and Pensions Secretary Mel Stride have both called for getting people of all ages back into the workplace to boost labor supply across the UK.
The proportion of people out of work has increased since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, but the problem is also seen to be driven by wider factors, including rising levels of disability and long-term illness.
A government spokesperson said: â€œWe are reducing inactivity and helping young people into work as we build on our track record of reducing youth unemployment by 43% since 2010.
â€œWe are investing Â£2.3 billion in mental health services and supporting more 16 and 17-year-olds to take part in education and apprenticeships.
â€œMore broadly our Back to Work scheme will help people with long-term health conditions, disabilities or who are long-term unemployed to get into and stay in work.â€
A Conservative spokesman accused Labor of having a â€œbrass neckâ€, saying that the party had â€œnever left office with lower unemployment than it inheritedâ€.
Source: uk.finance.yahoo.com
